about.intro: Mirlo provides a user-friendly space to help artists sell digital music, receive financial support, manage mailing lists, and share with their supporters.
about.missionStatement: <1>The music industry does not work for artists or listeners and needs a radical re-imagining.</1><2>Mirlo hosts a community of artists, listeners, organizers, and coders who are daring to do just that: taking lessons learned from working in the solidarity economy and applying them to our platform.</2><3>We are building an online audio distribution and patronage platform that aims to be radical, accessible, open source (free & libre), modular, and standards based.</3>
about.featuresText:
Mirlo provides a space for artists to upload their music, establish their online presence, sell their music, and receive ongoing monthly contributions from their audience.

For a thorough look at our features for artists, check out our features page.
about.pricingText:
Artists get to decide how much of their sale goes to Mirlo. They do this by setting a percentage on sales. So if an artist sells an album on for $10, they will decide whether Mirlo gets 70 cents, $1, or nothing. This lets artists decide how much of their money they need for themselves. By default, Mirlo charges 10% on each sale. Then, our payment processor Stripe, will take a cut of 2.9% + 30c (proportionally this is larger on small transactions).

Want to know more about our thought process? Check out our blog post explaining how we got there.

As we develop our project and come to terms with the costs of running it, we will adjust these numbers and explore new ways of financing Mirlo.
about.morePricing: As we develop our project and come to terms with costs of running it, we will tweak these numbers and explore new ways of paying for the service and our work.

platformSlider.howMuchModalText: Mirlo thrives on artist contributions—whether through monthly support or a slice of album sales. But we get it: every cent counts, and only you know what you can afford. That’s why we let you decide how much of your sales goes to Mirlo. Your art, your call.
platformSlider.howMuchModalRowFullCostDescription: Best estimate to cover all our work.
platformSlider.howMuchModalRowRedistributionDescription: You really want to see Mirlo succeed and you can afford it.
platformSlider.howMuchModalCalculator: If you're having trouble deciding on a rate, you can use <link>this sliding scale calculator</link> for individuals (in english) provided by the Aorta Co-operative.
platformSlider.howMuchModalFinances: Curious about how Mirlo uses money? We post quarterly financial statements <link>on our blog</link>.

manageAlbum.receivePaymentDescription: You are seeing this because you are part of a label. This is the account that will receive payments for this release. If you are part of a label or collective, this will be the label or collective account. Go to your <artistPage>artist page</artistPage> to manage these relationships. If you leave this blank, payments will continue going to your personal account.
manageAlbum.labelReceivePaymentDescription: You are a label who can manage albums for this artist. This is the account that will receive payments for this release. Go to your <labelPage>label page</labelPage> to manage these relationships. If you leave this blank, payments will go to the artist's personal account.

home.mirloConstruction:
Wanna talk more? E-mail us or join our Discord! Also check out our About page, and the code on GitHub.

Want to just receive our monthly newsletter? Sign up

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq.faqDescription: Some frequently asked questions about Mirlo
